title: Magnetic force - terminal speed of falling loops

content.question: Two conducting loops are dropped into a region where a magnetic field of strength <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> is directed out of the page. Loop <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math>, resistance <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, and horizontal length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math>. Loop <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has mass <math alttext="2 m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></math>, resistance <math alttext="2 R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></math>, and horizontal length <math alttext="2 L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>L</mi></math>. When entering the magnetic field, both loops experience a magnetic force that opposes the force of gravity and they reach terminal speed before they are completely in the magnetic field. How does the terminal speed <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> for Loop <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> compare to the terminal speed <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> for Loop <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub 2 equals, one half times v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="v sub 2 equals v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="v sub 2 equals 2 v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="v sub 2 equals 4 v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="v sub 2 equals v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>
